reviews.text: My family stayed here for 4 nights starting 10/31. WE booked the hotel as part of a package on Priceline, because we were coming for a college football game and this was the "headquarters" picked for Tiger fans.
reviews.title: A fine place to stay

reviews.text: Anyway, the location was fabulous...almost couldn't be better. We were so close to the T, so we could get anywhere we wanted. The lobby was really pretty and seemed well-kept-up.
reviews.title: Marriott Factory Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our corner room on the 31 floor had spectacular city views. The room was pretty clean. I did note a hair on the shower wall that didn't belong to us, but otherwise, I had no complaints about cleanliness.
reviews.title: great hotel, great location

reviews.text: There were only two things that kept me from giving this hotel a higher rating: 1 - minimal space for clothing (there were 4 of us in this room, with only 3 small drawers) and 2 - (and this was the biggie) the beds and pillows were horribly uncomfortable. The mattresses were really squashy. Not so much lumpy - just really soft. The first night I hardly slept at all. The pillows are similarly squashy...and small...I could ball it up and fit it under my neck. Fortunately, after spending our days walking miles around the city, we were all exhausted enough to sleep even though the beds were uncomfortable.
reviews.title: great for dad

reviews.text: Over all, though, I'd stay here again. Maybe by next time, they'll update the mattresses.
reviews.title: Many problems again
Great one night stay
reviews.text: Booked through Priceline a day or two before for $85 on a Sunday night. Arrived early in the afternoon and were given a high floor with a nice view as the concierge levels were sold out. Very helpful staff and the lady checking us in tried to upgrade us due to my Marriott status even though she knew we booked through Priceline. Room was nice and clean. I realized a day or two later that I had left my charger in my room. While housekeeping couldn't find it, the head of that dept (JoAnn) offered to let me come by the hotel and look through the other chargers that were never claimed as we were still in town due to bad weather cancelling our flight back to Dallas. One other thing of note, each day there is a water dispenser placed near the check-in counter. Each day it has something different added to it for flavoring. We tried orange, lemon, and orange with mint while we were in town. I must recommend the orange w/ mint!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel one weekend in June. When we arrived, I mentioned to the front desk clerk that it was our seven year wedding anniversary. She said she would find us a great room, and she did; we had a corner room on the 33rd floor with lovely views of the city. We left the room to go to dinner, and when we returned a few hours later, there was a tray of strawberries, wine, and cream (all complimentary) and a Happy Anniversary card. Not only was this a complete surprise, but the strawberries and cream were outstanding. The location is perfect; it was chilly for June, so it was definitely a plus not having to go outdoors for access to stores and restaurants. Also, the price was very reasonable, at ~$200/night before taxes. My only complaint is that the bathroom was tiny. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great staff, great location, great views

reviews.text: Have stayed here many times, when in Boston and always found the hotel excellent. Rooms good, spacious, clean and with nice views, gym good and shopping center just a short walk away. Good concierge desk and staff always pleasant. Shall look forward to my next stay.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: Not much to add over the other reviews - great location, well maintained. Didn't see much more because in a conference in a nearby hotel.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: I guess the only things to add is that the rooms are relatively small, though the bathroom was good. Being tall normally showers come up to my shoulder at best, but could stand under this and was a good shower. Layout of lobby areas bit weird and soulless - seems to be floating between the road level and bridge into the shopping centre proper - could do with a proper entrance from the shopping centre and signage to mark where it starts and finishes.
reviews.title: Just what I needed

likes.disliked: — The automatic tip w/ room service

reviews.text: Location can't be beat if you like to dine and shop! The bed and pillows were my favorite part...so comfy and clean. We had an OK stay here...I was in Boston for a baptism and most of my family stayed at this hotel. The first night, my in-laws said that the hotel had given their room away, and were awoken in the middle of the night to other guests! They had a room key to the room and my in-laws had to kick them out of the room! We did contact the manager of the hotel, and they were very apologetic about it....but STILL! Would I stay here again? Yes, because of the location.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay...BUT

reviews.text: This hotel is in the perfect location for both work and play. There is a big 24 hours supermarket just across the road from the hotel. Service staff are all extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Nice location, Good service

reviews.text: Biggest negative was the elevators -- you had to wait forever to get to your room because they were so poorly controlled and slow. There were two banks that served upto the 27th floor and a four elevator bank to serve the upper floors. The controller for the elevators was clearly not working as it took an extremely long time to get an elevator no matter if you were on your room floor heading down or in the lobby going up. I was not the only one frustrated by this as every time I rode the elevator I heard complaints.
reviews.title: Okay but below Marriott standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service in the conceirge lounge was exceptional. Very attentive and accomodating.
reviews.title: R&R

reviews.text: Room was okay but a bit sparse for a Marriott. The furniture was standard Marriott but the bathroom (especially the shower) was a bit dated. Nothing detrimental but not a plus either.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: I stayed here for a week for a business trip in Boston. This was my first stay in the city, and the hotel couldn't have been better placed. The hotel itself is attached to a very nice shopping mall, and the back bay area has a large selection of restaurants and shops. The rooms were fine, the beds were comfortable and the walls seemed to keep out any noise from other rooms.
reviews.title: Excellent location, nice rooms.

reviews.text: The Hotel is at the best Boston location to tour the city. I am a platinum member for Marriott and was treated to a suite and great buffet breakfast. Gym and pool were great. I will be back with family again.
reviews.title: The best Location in Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for a few nights over Christmas. I love the Back Bay location but the rooms are very old and warn out. The lobby is recently done and very nice. The staff are very accomodating and the Champions bar was great. The view in the room was wonderful, on such a high floor. Did not see the pool or healthclub. The bathroom in the room was tiny and very outdated. The beds were not that comfortable and the rooms are in desparate need for updating.
reviews.title: Great Location, Tired Hotel Rooms

reviews.text: I have stayer here twice in the last few months. The location is excellent. Boston is a walking city and you can walk to all areas of the city from here. There are also 2 T stops within a block. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. All the staff were very friendly. This is a good choice in Boston.
reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel

reviews.text: Stayed with another family and they gave us a suite and adjoining room. Great!
reviews.title: In the heart of it all

reviews.text: Nothing negative to say about this hotel. Our room was on the 25th floor with a view to the river, it was newly refurbished and extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for a City Break

reviews.text: The hotel is attached to 2 shopping malls and is situated between 2 T stations.This subway system is so easy & cheap to use for travel all over the city. It's within walking distance of the chic Newbury St which is great for shopping and dining and Boston Common and the beginning of the Freedom trail.
reviews.title: Great location with an excellent weekend deal.

reviews.text: Have stayed in Boston a couple of times now and in my opinion this hotel can't be bettered for location.
reviews.title: Good spot for a conference

reviews.text: It is in the heart of the best shopping area of the city. Pool, fitness center are excellent. Once you arrive you need not put on a coat until you lerave. Everything one could need is right there. We had a great weekend.
reviews.title: Great location and room

reviews.text: I visited the Boston Marriott Copley Place for a conference between Nov. 30 and Dec. 3, 2011. The location is pretty good in Boston's Back Bay neighbourhood. Copley Place is in the middle of a massive shopping area with a Shaw's across the street and 2 level mall with around 100 stores attached to the hotel. My room on the 26th floor was newly renovated and clean if not simple. The meeting areas were excellent and comfortably accommodated our conference of over 1000 people. The food at the conference, catered by the hotel was also excellent. We went for food and drinks one night at the bar on the 2nd floor called Champions, which was good pub fare and had huge screens for watching sports. The hotel is about a 30 buck cab ride from the airport.
reviews.title: Good for a conference

reviews.text: we stayed in another hotel in boston but had breakfast at the Marriott each morning. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and buffet breakfast was only $4.95 for kids
reviews.title: Great breakast service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I booked the hotel through priceline, name your own price and we received an excellent deal. The hotel was in a good location, but was extremely busy. The hotel is attached to two malls and there are always people coming in and out. That said there are a ton of places to eat, but all chains. The hotel is near the T, walking distance to Fenway and other quintessential Boston sites.
reviews.title: Nice Location

reviews.text: We were at the hotel for a wedding on a Saturday night. The hotel made about $50,000 on this large wedding yet they continuously nickeled and dimed their guests.
reviews.title: Rip Off
Loved the Boston Marriott Copley Place Hotel!
reviews.text: 1. They charged $7.00 for a beer and $9.00 for a mixed drink at the wedding - ridiculous.
2. The entree portions were so small that my whole table went to Champions bar after the wedding to get some $12 appetizers because we were starving.
reviews.title: The Complete Package
Good Stay
reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Location is Great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First the not-so-good. Too large and impersonal (1100 rooms), part of the Copley Mall complex (exclusive shopping), expensive parking ($30 per day), no hotel restaurant and expensive room service (add 20%-25% Service and then add tax).
reviews.title: There's more good than bad

reviews.text: But then, good location for tourist areas, a large corner room with views from the 24th floor, Starbuck's and other restaurants in the lobby area, Shaw's supermarket across from the hotel entrance, an empty fridge and tea/coffee maker for guest use,
reviews.title: Wouldn't be my first choice

reviews.text: Taking all into account, after enjoying Boston all day, the hotel was a comfortable retreat.
reviews.title: Nice place, but not as good as the price demands

reviews.text: I'm here right now for a business event . I was unimpressed as soon as I walked into my room. It looks a little old (early 1990's maybe) and not in the "colonial" way they probably intended. I found hair (not my own) in the bathroom sink. I've stayed at nicer hotels for a fraction of the high rate here. Not impressed.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: Not a bad stay -- simply a typical Marriott experience -- nothing overwhelming about the experience. The hotel's location is one of its strong points, Back Bay, connected to Copley Place, Prudential Center's Marketplace and the Hynes Convention Center. I was there during a cold spell (2 degrees outside) so it was nice not having to walk outside to get places.
reviews.title: A Hotel Geared Toward Conventioneers

reviews.text: The room was decent - fairly modern decor with comfortable beds. The hotel, I believe, is or will be, undergoing a room renovation. It needs it, as my room on the 28th floor had a big nasty yellow stain on one of the walls.
reviews.title: The first time i left a hotel disappointed , Gross service,& Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a discriminating staff.. If you are booking from price line they give you an attitude off bat.. the feel like you don't belong there because you did not pay full price... And if you are a minority every one will look at you strange.. The rooms are nice but the staff that you have to deal with in order to get it.. Makes the room not worth it.. I have stayed at allot of hotels but that hotel by far is the worst and they don't care.. So if i was to rate this hotel i would rate it STAY AWAY if you are a minority or you will end up at the local discrimination office.. I HAVE NEVER LEFT A HOTEL FEELING DISRESPECTED... Good luck with trying to get a staff with a non-bias opion of you!..
reviews.title: great central location

reviews.text: It is in the copley mall so it is very upscale... Has nice shops as far a Louis Vuttion, Salvotor Farragamo, and Saks Fifth just to name a few.. There is a cafeteria in the mall, and it has GOOD FOOD. The hotel food is gross the buffalo wing are to spicy.. and the "dominos" pizza is gross soggy undercooked and pilled with nasty cheese and to expensive for that and a drink almost plus 4% + 18% +4.00+ gratuity almost 60 $.. And also the don't do free internet 12.95$ this hotel is over priced with a Unorganized staff.. If you get a hotel here make sure you don't get it threw a bargain site...
reviews.title: Nice Place to Stay in Bad Weather

reviews.text: If you want to save money don't book here. They put a barley visual sing in your room saying "no smoking" and then they charge you 250$ For not telling you.. But you want to save money when you go to that hotel just don't get room service.. And not let remind you about the 20$ tip you like have to give to house keeping.. If you are on a budget and you want good hotel service.. There are other hotels in the area that are more put together and way more cheaper then the Marriot.. There is a Shaws across the street but the hotel staff will look at you even more weird if they see you bringing out side food in there hotel...
reviews.title: Great Location, clean rooms.
Great Hotel, Great Location
reviews.text: We stayed one night after bringing our daughter up to Boston U for their summer program. As a Marriott rewards member, we got a complimentary upgrade to the club floor which included continental bkfast and hors d'oerves and desert in the evening. Great deal (we only payed $149 for the night)! The room was small but very nice, with a fantastic view of the city. Boston is great and this Marriott is in a really nice area, we walked everywhere - to Copley Square, the Public Garden, Boston Common, etc... The hotel is also connected to an incredible mall, which was fun to walk through even at night after the stores were closed. Overall, an excellent stay, highly recommended. Tip: keep checking back to Marriott website, the rate kept going down closer to the date, and we got it adjusted a couple of times!

reviews.title: Very Mediocre
reviews.text: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the Mariott Copley place, and found it to be very very ordinary. Definitely not a 4 star place, like it is listed at some place on the internet. The location is great, but there are 2 other hotels connected to the same mall (the Sheraton and the Westin) and both are much nicer than the Mariott. the best part of the location it is right across the street from a shaws (grocery store), which makes it convenient if you want to grab a case of water. Otherwise there is absolutely no advantage to staying here. All other hotels at Copley are just at close to the Subway as this hotel.
Here is the downside:
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: 1) small rooms, I know this is the east coast, but other hotels in boston can offer large rooms
reviews.title: A Great Place To Stay When You're In Boston!

likes.disliked: — Wait at the front desk upon check-in

reviews.text: 2) very very slow elevators. They really take forever to get you to your room
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a platinum member, we had a high floor with a "corner" room with decent views of the city. All in all it was a very good stay that we've come to expect from full service Marriotts.
reviews.title: Good Overall Stay

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay in this hotel, central location.
reviews.title: Central Location

reviews.text: The rooms are standard Marriott decor and the staff pleasant.
reviews.title: Happy New Year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great base for shopping and touring the city.
reviews.title: Great location for business or pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We headed to the Marriot on a last minute New Year's weekend whim. The wait to check in was really bad. When we did reach the counter, our room wasn't ready. So, we walked around a bit only to return an hour later to find it still wasn't ready. The concierge said he had another room with a view of the fireworks. Unfortunately, he was wrong about the view. Still the room was very nice. It was really clean which is super important to me. The location is great for getting around and the attatched mall was really pleasant bonus. The pool area is super and was the reason we chose this hotel over others. We dined at the hotel restaurant and ordered room service during our stay and were pleased each time. All in all, this hotel provided us with a great start to the New Year!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from our Memorial Day trip to Boston and stayed at the Boston Marriott Copley Place. It was our first time in Boston and we could not have picked a better hotel. Our room was super - a wonderful bed, great shower, and terfrific view.
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay!

reviews.text: One of the best qualities was its location. Only a few blocks away from the T station that took us everywhere we wanted to go. The hotel is also connected to 2 malls and as many restaurants and a Starbucks inside. We did eat at the Championship restaurant on the main floor and found it to be very good.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Across the street from the hotel is a Shaw's grocery store. Perfect for picking up snacks or breakfast items since our room had a refrigerator and a coffee pot!
reviews.title: New bedding & great views!

reviews.text: When we return to Boston we will not think twice about where to stay. It will be at the Boston Marriott Copley Place.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: Enjoyed my two-night stay at this hotel. Very clean, staff was helpful and courteous, and the location was great. Although there was a conference going on, waits for elevators were not excessive. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Boston!

likes.liked: — personal service, spacious rooms for Boston

reviews.text: Stayed at the Marriot for a conference and the fact that it is across the street from the Back Bay Station is great. However that's the last time I would use that particular adjective when describing this Marriot. The rooms are starting to show their age and painting a door multiple times will not help. The elevators don't seem to be able to keep up with a large crowd and you'll find yourself waiting quite awhile on some occasions. The breakfast at Gourmeli's is typical of any hotel overpriced for the quality and while the staff is courteous, the size of the hotel will not allow for anything resembling personal service. It's convenient, but I imagine there are other places nearby that would prove superior.
reviews.title: The only great thing about it is the location

reviews.text: I stayed here last week on business. It is a nice hotel but overwhelming at times. It is well located in the Back Bay and connected to a high-end mall. Plus you can walk indoors thru the mall to another mall and cross about four blocks without going outside. Nice when it is cold outside.
reviews.title: Nice but a factory

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, this place is huge and difficult to find your way around. It really is a factory, although well run. The hotel has no character but offers nice rooms, typical Marriott amenities, efficient service and a good location. In my opinion, this hotel is perfect for a business trip but a special occasion I would try somewhere more interesting.
reviews.title: parking Garage fee and policy sucks

reviews.text: Nice Hotel.But they need to correct one thing
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.text: If you park your car (it cost 35.00)you can no longer go in and out as much as you want like other hotels.You must pay each time.
reviews.title: not worth the money
